title: Taking the Fourth Root.
text: What is $$\sqrt[4]{16}$$, what can be multiplied by itself $$4$$ times to get 16? $$2^4=16$$. Therefore $$\sqrt[4]{16}=2=f(4)$$.
speech: What is  the fourth root of 16 , what can be multiplied by itself  4  times to get 16?  2 to the fourth is equal to, 16 . Therefore  the fourth root of 16 is equal to 2 is equal to f of 4 .
